action.action-desc: Mr. Rice of South Carolina (for himself and Mr. Garamendi) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To require the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency to submit to Congress reports describing the average amount of individual assistance and individual and household assistance provided to certain individuals and households and the rate of denial of such assistance, and for other purposes.

section.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Homeland Security and Government Affairs of the Senate a report with respect to fiscal year 2016 through the most recent fiscal year ending before the date of enactment of this Act, and an annual report for any fiscal year beginning on or after the date of enactment of this Act, describing—

paragraph.text: the average amount of individual assistance and individual and household assistance provided under section 408 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5174), and the rate of denial of household assistance provided under such section, for—

subparagraph.text: applications containing a self-reported annual income under 75 percent of the national median household income (as calculated by the Bureau of the Census);
applications containing a self-reported annual income over 125 percent of such national median household income; and
applications with a self-reported annual income between 75 percent and 125 percent of such national median household income; and

paragraph.text: an explanation for any factors causing an increase in the rate of denial of such assistance, if applicable.
